last_episode_to_air.name: Pop Goes the Stash
last_episode_to_air.overview: Kevin and the boys attend the grand opening of Funko's new headquarters, where they get honored with their very own Pop! figures.

name: Comic Book Men
overview: A show for Fanboys by Fanboys. Set in uber-geek Kevin Smith's iconic comic shop Jay and Silent Bob's Secret Stash, the show explores every nook and cranny of Fanboy culture from A to Z. Endless circular debates about the technical accuracy of the USS Enterprise's warp-core schematics? Snarky comic aficionados with an encyclopedic knowledge of every Marvel back issue? You bet.

episodes.name: Junk
episodes.overview: Walt challenges Bryan, Ming and Mike to a Collingswood Flea Market selling contest. Items a plenty come in for sale, some good, some not so much. We're also treated to a masterclass from Rob Bruce.

episodes.name: Life After Clerks
episodes.overview: Kevin blows into town and gets the Stash staff to face off in a game of street hockey.

episodes.name: Commercial
episodes.overview: Walt thinks it’s time for the Stash to shoot a commercial. Later, a customer brings in something really special.

episodes.name: Zombies
episodes.overview: Walt lets Ming run a sales promotion for the Stash based on Zombies.

episodes.name: Con Gone Wrong
episodes.overview: Walt and the guys head to a convention where, after a setback, they strike gold among trash. Later, a customer brings in an item that Mike covets.

episodes.name: Ink
episodes.overview: Walt challenges the staff to get tattoos. A woman arrives at the Stash looking for a romantic gift for her boyfriend, a man wants to sell a Green Lantern movie prop replica, Bryan shows interest in a woman's collection of Barbie dolls dressed as super-heroes, Walt negotiates for a set of Target-exclusive Batman figures, and a young man resembling Kirk Cameron brings in a number of old books to offer.

episodes.name: Stash Bashes
episodes.overview: The guys throw a birthday bash and later on a customer brings in unusual "Star Wars" memorabilia.

episodes.name: My Big Fat Geek Wedding
episodes.overview: All bets are on when the guys take in a local auction and a customer discovers that cigars and comic books don't mix.

episodes.name: Ghostbusting at the Stash
episodes.overview: The guys go on a quest to find the legendary Jersey Devil and a customer tries to unload ThunderCats figures.

episodes.name: Ming in Charge
episodes.overview: Ming gets to run the store when Walt and Mike take sick; and a customer has first issues of "Iron Man" and "Daredevil" to sell. Ming convinces "Clerks" star Brian "Dante Hicks" O'Halloran to help out.

episodes.name: The Sidewalk Stash
episodes.overview: Ming convinces the other guys to let him represent the Stash in the town's annual sidewalk sale.

episodes.name: The Running Dead
episodes.overview: Kevin holds a 5km zombie run for charity that Ming and Mike agree to participate in; Walt makes a deal for an odd item containing autographs from the 1966 "Batman" TV series.

episodes.name: Tough Sh*t
episodes.overview: Kevin visits the Stash for a book signing; Jay acts as security; a customer brings in original artwork.

episodes.name: Stan the Man
episodes.overview: The staff prepare for a visit from Stan Lee and Walt has the opportunity to purchase one of the most coveted comic books of the past two decades.

episodes.name: The Clash at the Stash
episodes.overview: The Stash sells an independent comic book so the guys can see a costumed M.M.A fight; Walt buys nostalgic underwear to use in a bet.

episodes.name: Super Hoagie
episodes.overview: The guys have a showdown at a local deli (who have sandwiches made for city fixtures) to see who can make the best sandwich that will represent the Secret Stash.

episodes.name: Stash-teroids
episodes.overview: Walt negotiates for an original Asteroids arcade cabinet. Ming is excited about G.I Joe figures.

episodes.name: Con Men
episodes.overview: The Stash organizes an auction to help a long time customer/friend sell his comic collection for mounting medical bills. Another customer relates to one of Spider-Man's deadliest enemies.

episodes.name: Stash Wars
episodes.overview: A customer tries an unusual strategy to sell a popular gaming system, while Ming purchases more nostalgic childhood memorabilia.

episodes.name: Cryptozoic Men
episodes.overview: The guys try to create their own comic book. Walt buys a signed issue of Creepy.

episodes.name: Comic Charades
episodes.overview: The guys play charades with a comic-book theme, while Walt seizes an opportunity to purchase original artwork from a favorite artist.

episodes.name: Giant-Sized Anniversary
episodes.overview: Ming plans a surprise for Walt's anniversary at The Stash; Ming learns the virtue of patience.

episodes.name: The Incredible Bulk
episodes.overview: Lou Ferrigno gives Bryan a lesson on fitness; a customer wants to purchase a key comic by Frank Miller.

episodes.name: To the Bat Cave
episodes.overview: The staff at the Stash receives an invitation to visit a bat cave and a customer arrives at the shop intending to sell his collection of original "Star Wars" action figures.

episodes.name: Super Friends
episodes.overview: The guys ask George Perez to help rebuild Mike's collection; vintage interactive comic books.

episodes.name: USS Ming
episodes.overview: Ming has the chance to purchase an oversized toy from the '80s; taking a wife on the perfect date.

episodes.name: Pity the Fools
episodes.overview: A fan sells a Mr. T backyard water game; Ming is inspired to have fun on a hot day; Walt risks the shop's street credibility.

episodes.name: Walt's Big Gamble
episodes.overview: The guys bid on derelict storage units in hopes of striking it rich; Walt finds a fellow Elfquest fanatic.

episodes.name: Dukes of Jersey
episodes.overview: A fan of "The Dukes of Hazzard" stops by to show off his collection of memorabilia; Walt encounters his first "brony."

episodes.name: Cryptozoic Launch
episodes.overview: The guys travel to the Baltimore Comic Con to launch their comic book, "Cryptozoic Man"; Jeff works on a Saturday to fill in for Walt.

episodes.name: Superman's 75th
episodes.overview: A customer buys a gift for his father's 75th birthday; the Stash throws a party for Superman's 75th birthday.

episodes.name: Uhura's Uhura
episodes.overview: A woman is looking for an Uhura Mego doll from the '70s; an X-Men fan buys the first appearance of Phoenix.

episodes.name: Pinheads
episodes.overview: Walt is inspired to form a bowling team; an ill-conceived action figure shows up.

episodes.name: Trivia Chew-Off
episodes.overview: Bored, Walt quizzes the guys on comic book trivia; a customer sells a Hellboy prop replica.

episodes.name: The Esposito Collection
episodes.overview: The Stash helps auction off the work of Mike Esposito; Walt buys a paper doll.

episodes.name: Batcycle on Broad
episodes.overview: The guys have the opportunity to buy a replica of the '66 Batcycle; a collection of Marvel fan magazines from the '70s.

episodes.name: Certified Guaranty
episodes.overview: A young man wants to appraise his collection; Walt buys Wayne Gretzky memorabilia.

episodes.name: Knights of the Stash
episodes.overview: Jason Mewes invites the guys to a Renaissance fair; a customer brings in a valuable item.

episodes.name: Heir Apparent
episodes.overview: Kevin Smith sends his daughter to the Stash to learn how to be a clerk; a customer wants to sell rare and unusual "Rocky" action figures.

episodes.name: Walt's Treehouse
episodes.overview: A returning customer brings in a toy that Walt always coveted; an aspiring student brings in an autographed book.

episodes.name: Stand Up Guys
episodes.overview: Walt challenges the others to perform stand-up routines; a collector brings in Marvel comics from the 1960s.

episodes.name: Super Baby
episodes.overview: The guys agree to baby-sit a friend's daughter for the afternoon; an Indiana Jones superfan has items from the films.

episodes.name: BronyCon
episodes.overview: Walt and the others attend BronyCon, a convention for "My Little Pony" fans; a customer wants to sell a Godzilla board game from the 1970s.

episodes.name: Bat Prints
episodes.overview: Walt considers buying the hand and footprints of Adam West and Burt Ward; a rare set of Star Wars comic strips.

episodes.name: Turtle Time
episodes.overview: The co-creator of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Kevin Eastman, brings in early sketches of the turtles.

episodes.name: Stashbusters
episodes.overview: Walt has a business proposition for original Ghostbuster, Ernie Hudson; a customer wants to sell cartoon shampoo bottles from the 1960s.

episodes.name: Dragging Rights
episodes.overview: Adam West visits and a race between the Batmobile and Black Beauty ensues.

episodes.name: Mr. Adams
episodes.overview: Artist Neal Adams and writer Denny O'Neil visit the Stash; the guys see a set of 50-year-old Batman night lights.

episodes.name: My Favorite Munster
episodes.overview: Butch Patrick (Eddie Munster) stops by the Stash; a rare Star Wars action figure.

episodes.name: Secret Stashley
episodes.overview: Kevin's assistant, Ashley, learns about comic book retail at the Stash; pro wrestlers want to sell their comic.

episodes.name: Sucka M.C.
episodes.overview: Darryl McDaniels of Run DMC brings his new comic to the Stash; the guys look at a Marvel Silver Age number one issue.

episodes.name: Falcon for Sale
episodes.overview: Billy Dee Williams stops by the store to win the Millennium Falcon the same way Lando lost it: a high-stakes card game.

episodes.name: KISS My Stash
episodes.overview: The guys attend a KISS concert; Walt lives out his childhood dream of meeting Gene Simmons.

episodes.name: Jay Invades
episodes.overview: Jason Mewes hangs out and plays clerk at the Stash; Walt wants to acquire a mysterious recreation of comic book art.

episodes.name: Wookiee Fever
episodes.overview: Peter Mayhew (best known for playing "Chewbacca" in Star Wars) judges a Wookiee contest at the Stash.

episodes.name: Holy Zap Copter!
episodes.overview: Mike flies in the original '66 Batcopter to celebrate 15 years working at the Secret Stash. Also, one of the hottest comic books of the '90s enters the Stash.

episodes.name: Captain and the Clerk
episodes.overview: Kevin talks comics with actor William Shatner and Walt covets a Mego doll that has unique packaging.

episodes.name: Bryan Gets Bit
episodes.overview: The guys and Bryan visit a "Jaws" museum; super-powered toilet paper comes through.

episodes.name: Stash-pocalypse
episodes.overview: A hot zombie comic prompts the guys to reconsider their apocalyptic preparations. An eccentric collector comes seeking Walt's help.

episodes.name: Stan Saves!
episodes.overview: Stan Lee drops by the Stash and helps the guys with a customer experiencing a comics crisis. A customer buys a classic issue of Fantastic Four.

episodes.name: Making Clay
episodes.overview: Walt and Bryan audition the Secret Stash employees for a role in their new claymation film with friend and fellow podcaster Brian Quinn.

episodes.name: Royal Romita
episodes.overview: Legendary comics artist John Romita Jr. draws an original piece for the Stash. Bryan’s interest is piqued by an Evel Knievel toy from his childhood.

episodes.name: Suburban Cowboys
episodes.overview: An old pal inspires the gang to don their cowboy hats and journey back to the old Wild West. A customer comes in seeking an iconic ’80s comic.

episodes.name: Tell 'Em, Jim Lee!
episodes.overview: Artist Jim Lee shares tales from the world of comics on the podcast; a comic book brings wedding bells to the Stash.

episodes.name: Insta-Ming
episodes.overview: When Ming gets a selfie stick, he tries to go viral by filming the Stash; Walt examines bootleg toys of an '80s blockbuster.

episodes.name: Baby Jay
episodes.overview: Jason Mewes brings his baby daughter to the Stash so she can meet the guys. Later, a customer sells a collection of comic-book Slurpee cups.

episodes.name: Hometown Heroes
episodes.overview: In the fifth-season finale, Phoenix Jones, a real-life superhero, visits the Stash and patrols Red Bank, N.J., with the guys. Later, Walt reminisces about an iconic Batman playset.

episodes.name: Bucket List
episodes.overview: Walt & the boys go on a trip to cross off a bucket-list item: being in the presence of Action Comics #1. Four key Spider-Man issues come to the Stash.

episodes.name: Mistress of the Stash
episodes.overview: Horror queen Elvira helps out when the Stash sponsors a blood drive at the shop. The boys banter about the joys of Mystery Science Theater 3000.

episodes.name: Pac-Ming
episodes.overview: Ming battles a customer when a vintage 1980s Pac-Man game lands on the counter. A rare Beatles board game has the guys flipping their mop-tops!

episodes.name: KITT and Caboodle
episodes.overview: KITT from "Knight Rider" pulls up to the Stash; a rare Green Arrow Mego figure and Archie Bunker's grandson.

episodes.name: Bionic Customer
episodes.overview: Lindsay Wagner ("The Bionic Woman") stops in for a Silver Surfer item; Jem and Ghostbusters toys spark another round of banter.

episodes.name: Joust-A-Bouts
episodes.overview: Things get medieval when Ming and a customer joust over the price of Batman #111. Later, Wolverine shows up as the largest statue to ever enter the Stash.

episodes.name: Wurst Episode Ever
episodes.overview: Kevin and Harley come to town for the Yoga Hosers premiere. Later, Ming gets transformed into the lead villain by a special-effects-makeup legend.

episodes.name: Stash Troopers
episodes.overview: Members of the 501st Legion of Storm Troopers invade the Stash looking for new recruits. Later, lives are at stake over the fate of a vintage Ewok playset.

episodes.name: Karate Kustomer
episodes.overview: Ralph Macchio stops by looking for a rare Karate Kid playset, and Ming gets a lesson he’ll never forget. Walt flips over a pricey Mechagodzilla.

episodes.name: Bats Ahoy!
episodes.overview: The guys prepare for a maritime adventure when the Batboat docks in Red Bank; Batman's first appearance.

episodes.name: Return of the Mewes
episodes.overview: Jason Mewes hangs with the boys and inserts himself into transactions involving a Deadshot statue and a vintage Death Star Space Station.

episodes.name: Daughter of the Demon
episodes.overview: Actress Katrina Law (``Arrow'') wants a copy of Batman 232; old school items involving Popeye, Dynomutt and Pogs.

episodes.name: Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Stash
episodes.overview: Walt steps into the ring with a customer over an original Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Robots game; a rare piece of original Sal Buscema art.

episodes.name: Marky Ramone-Bot
episodes.overview: Ramones drummer Marky Ramone shows off his artwork and bonds with Walt over old school robots. A King Kong item bring the boys back to 1975.

episodes.name: The Amazing Walter
episodes.overview: A Kreskin ESP game reveals Walt’s secret powers of cognition. Items inspire discussions about Mork from Ork and Dick Tracy's Rogues' Gallery.

episodes.name: Reverse Stash
episodes.overview: The boys get a visit from Tom Cavanagh who plays Reverse Flash on _The Flash_ TV series. Walt sniffs out a Golden Age classic with _Human Torch #2_.

episodes.name: Return of the Living Stash
episodes.overview: Kevin Smith and the guys discuss how The Walking Dead started out as a comic book and became a cultural phenomenon.

episodes.name: Nightmare on Broad Street
episodes.overview: Legendary horror icon Robert Englund, aka Freddy Krueger, personally delivers a birthday present to Ming.

episodes.name: Hail to the King
episodes.overview: The Stash & Red Bank cosplayers celebrate the Centennial of the late, great Jack Kirby, one of the greatest innovators in comic book history.

episodes.name: Method Man's Mego
episodes.overview: Influential actor and rapper Method Man talks to the guys about his extensive comic book collection. Starsky & Hutch gear takes over The Stash.

episodes.name: Stash Bash
episodes.overview: Jay & Silent Bob cosplayers take over the streets of Red Bank as the Comic Book Men attempt to make history by setting a Guinness World Record.

episodes.name: In a Galaxy Very Nearby
episodes.overview: With rare and interesting Star Wars items making their way into the Stash, Walt offers up big cash to try and score a beacon for the store.

episodes.name: Ode to Clerks
episodes.overview: Kevin Smith and the guys attend a premiere screening of Shooting Clerks, a film about themselves and how Clerks came to be.

episodes.name: The Canine Crusaders
episodes.overview: Burt Ward, the infamous Robin the Boy Wonder, reminisces about his time on the set of Batman. He also judges the Stash's Canine Cosplay contest.

episodes.name: Power Man vs. Counter Man
episodes.overview: Walt meets his match during a heated negotiation with actor Mike Colter (Luke Cage); a "legendary" video game becomes both Walt's trash and Ming's treasure.

episodes.name: Troma-tized
episodes.overview: Troma Entertainment co-founder Lloyd Kaufman and his crew put the guys through a grueling audition to see if they have what it takes to be in a Troma film.

episodes.name: A Pez-tacular Mystery
episodes.overview: The boys take a field trip to the Pez Museum to determine if Walt is actually the owner of an extremely rare and valuable piece of Pez history.

episodes.name: The Mightiest of Mortals
episodes.overview: When Walt learns that Ming befriended actor Michael Gray (Shazam!), he decides that he must meet the "Mighty Mortal."

episodes.name: Pop Goes the Stash
episodes.overview: Kevin and the boys attend the grand opening of Funko's new headquarters, where they get honored with their very own Pop! figures.
